raw_text:
Sociedad set to rescue Mladenovic
 
 Rangers are set to loan out-of-favour midfielder Dragan Mladenovic to Real Sociedad, despite the closure of the January transfer window.
 
 Sociedad have been given special permission by the Spanish FA to sign a player due to an injury crisis. Mladenovic will effectively replace former Rangers midfielder Mikel Arteta, who has been loaned to Everton. Sociedad say they will pay Rangers £150,000, with an option to buy the Serbia & Montenegro international. Mladenovic's loan move is subject to him passing a medical. The 28-year-old, who joined Rangers from Red Star Belgrade for £1.2m in the close season, is expected in San Sebastian later this week following his national side's game against Bulgaria. Sociedad are in 15th place in the 20-strong Primera Liga, just two points above the relegation zone. Special permission from the Spanish FA came after an injury to central defender Igor Jauregi. The versatile Mladenovic can also play in the back four. His agent said last month that Rangers had told him to find the player a new club. Mladenovic's time at Ibrox has been plagued with injury and he has made just six starts in six months with the Glasgow club.
llama3.2:1b: Rangers are set to loan out Dragan Mladenovic to Real Sociedad due to an injury crisis, subject to his passing medical. Mladenovic is expected to replace former Rangers midfielder Mikel Arteta, who has been loaned to Everton. The transfer will be worth £150,000 and comes after a period of injury issues for the Serbia international.

Sociedad will pay £150,000 with an option to buy the Serbia & Montenegro international if he passes a medical. The 28-year-old joins after Rangers' agent told him to find a new club, as Mladenovic has made just six starts in six months due to injuries.

Sociedad received special permission from the Spanish FA to sign Mladenovic due to an injury crisis. The move is subject to a medical and will see Sociedad pay £150,000, with the option to buy him.

The 28-year-old will effectively replace former Rangers midfielder Mikel Arteta, who has been loaned to Everton. He'll be paid £150, 000, with an option to buy the Serbia & Montenegro international. Mladenovic's loan move is subject to him passing a medical. He was expected to play for Rangers in the 2018-2019 season following his injury to central defender Igor Jauregi.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Real Sociedad has signed midfielder Dragan Mladenovic from Rangers, who will loan for an undisclosed period due to an injury crisis, effective for a transfer fee of £150,000 and an option to buy. The Serbian player joins after leaving on loan at Everton earlier this season, expected in San Sebastian soon after his national team's game against Bulgaria. Sociedad is 15th in Primera Liga but just two points from the bottom; Mladenovic, 28, can play in both midfield and defense.
qwen2.5:3b: Rangers are set to loan Dragan Mladenovic to Real Sociedad, despite the January transfer window closure. The Spanish FA granted special permission for this signing due to a player shortage caused by injuries. Mladenovic will replace former Rangers midfielder Mikel Arteta, who has been loaned elsewhere. Sociedad will pay Rangers £150,000 and have an option to buy him. Mladenovic's move is subject to passing a medical, expected in San Sebastian later this week. He can play in the midfield or back four, having joined Rangers from Red Star Belgrade for £1.2m last summer. His time at Ibrox has been disrupted by injuries, with six starts in six months.

He can play in the back four and will pay Rangers £150,000 with an option to buy Serbia & Montenegro. Mladenovic's time at Ibrox is plagued with injury but made just six starts within six months with the club."

Rangers are set to give up Mikel Arteta due to an injury crisis and pay him £150,000 for his services as a replacement midfielder. The 28-year-old will also be expected in San Sebastian later this week following his national side's game against Bulgaria. Sociedad are in 15th place in the 20-strong Primera Liga, just two points above the relegation zone. Special permission from the Spanish FA came after an injury to central defender Igor Jauregi. The versatile Mladenovic can also play in the back four. His agent said last month that Rangers had told him to find the player a new club. Mladenovic's time at Ibrox has been plagued with injury and he has made just six starts in six months with the Glasgow club.
deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Okay, so I need to help someone summarize this text. Let me read through it first.

The text is about Real Sociedad trying to sign out-of-favour player Dragan Mladenovic from Rangers. The goal is to relieve pressure on the transfer window and allow a special permission from the Spanish FA because of an injury crisis. 

First, I should identify the key points: 
- Mladenovic is being loaned out.
- His replacement is Mikel Arteta from Everton, who has been at Real before.
- The loan move involves a payment of £150k plus an option to buy.
- He's expected to join later this week in Spain.
- There are injuries, so he might need medical attention.
- Mladenovic played for Rangers from 2014-15.
- His career there includes injury problems and only six starts in the last six months.

I need to make sure I capture all these without getting too detailed. The user wants a concise summary, just key ideas. So I'll list each main point concisely.

Maybe start with Mladenovic being loaned out of-favour for Mikel Arteta. Then mention the transfer window closure and the FA's permission. Next, payment details and possible buys. He joins Spain later this week due to injury, the injuries he had, and his previous experience at Rangers.

I should structure it in a way that flows logically: loan move, replacement, financial aspects, medical condition, joining time, injuries, experience.

Let me put this together into one concise sentence without extra fluff. Make sure each key point is included clearly.
</think>

The Rangers are considering re-signing out-of-favour midfielder Dragan Mladenovic to Real Sociedad for a loan due to an injury crisis and a closure in the January transfer window. The team will receive special permission from the Spanish FA following an injury. Mladenovic, who recently joined Rangers in December, is expected to join Spain later this week after playing in their national team against Bulgaria. He's in his late 20s and has faced injuries, making a limited number of appearances with Red Star Belgrade.
tinyllama:1.1b: Sociedad have been granted permission by the Spanish Football Federation to sign midfielder Dragan Mladenovic, who will temporarily replace Mikel Arteta at Everton as a loan deal lasts until the end of the season. The Serbian international has also reportedly agreed to undergo a medical with the La Liga side, and is expected to join them on an initial loan basis for the upcoming season. Mladenovic's loan move to San Sebastian follows his national team's recent game against Bulgaria, where he could potentially feature in the upcoming qualifying matches. Sociedad currently sit 15th in the 20-strong Primera Liga, just two points above the relegation zone. The decision to grant special permission for Mladenovic was made after a recent injury to Igor Jauregi at Ibri Stadium, and the versatile midfielder has been out since November due to a knee ligament injury.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Sociedad have rescued Dragan Mladenovic, a midfielder who was set to join Real Sociedad on loan from Rangers until his injury-hit spell at Ibrox led to an agreement being reached between both parties. This move will be subject to Mladenovic passing a medical and fulfilling any other requirements specified by the Spanish Football Federation (Federa Spana de Futbol). The 28-year-old Serbian international, who joined Rangers from Red Star Belgrade for £1.2m in August 2020, will join Sociedad on a season-long loan with an option to buy. Mladenovic has been out of action since February due to injury and will now be available as a backup option for the Spanish side.

This move comes after the retirement of former player Mikel Arteta who has been loaned to Everton. The deal also includes a £150,000 fee with an option to buy the Serbia & Montenegro international in the future.

He will replace Mikel Arteta, who was loaned to Everton. Sociedad will pay Rangers £150,000 with an option to buy, pending Mladenovic passing a medical. The 28-year-old, who joined Rangers from Red Star Belgrade for £1.2m, has struggled with injuries and made only six starts in six months. Sociedad, currently 15th in La Liga, sought reinforcements after an injury to defender Igor Jauregi. Mladenovic, who can also play in defense, is expected in San Sebastian after Serbia & Montenegro's game against Bulgaria.

Mladenovic will replace Mikel Arteta, who was previously loaned to Everton. Sociedad plans to pay £x amount ($y) to acquire Mladenovic from Rangers and has an option to buy him permanently. The versatile 26-year-old is expected to join the team later this week after his national side's game against Bulgaria. Real Sociedad currently sits in 10th place in the Primera Liga, just two points above the relegation zone, with special permission from the Spanish FA due to an injury to central defender Igor Jauregi.
granite3.1-dense:2b: Real Sociedad, facing an injury crisis, secures special permission from the Spanish FA to sign Dragan Mladenovic from Rangers. The 28-year-old Serbia & Montenegro international, valued at £1.2 million, will replace Mikel Arteta on loan, who was previously with Everton. Sociedad agrees to pay Rangers £150,000 and include an option to buy Mladenovic. His medical is pending, and he's anticipated in San Sebastian soon after Red Star Belgrade's match against Bulgaria. Despite his time at Ibrox being marred by injuries, limiting his appearances, Mladenovic can play as a defender or midfielder. Sociedad, currently 15th in the Primera Liga, two points above relegation, hopes this loan will address their defensive issues following central defender Igor Jauregi's injury.
